channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: The Bidens have a new pet cat in the White House, a 2-year-old Tabby named Willow https://t.co/DfdkupxXfe
A snow-covered bridge in Pittsburgh collapsed Friday morning, as the city prepared for a visit from President Biden centered on infrastructure https://t.co/YczH9wXxtE
A federal judge blocked an oil and gas lease sale of 80 million acres in the Gulf of Mexico, saying U.S. regulators used flawed environmental analysis https://t.co/PAGvBogjXC
Essay: When Beijing shut down a pro-democracy newspaper in Hong Kong, it gave the world a glimpse of the future it hopes to create https://t.co/DoMoPLmEEk
“I want to bring your attention to what I believe is Twitter’s unwitting complicity in curbing free and fair speech in India,” Mr. Gandhi wrote in the letter to Twitter's CEO https://t.co/86A2eCuXHF
The U.S. called for a meeting of the U.N. Security Council to discuss the standoff over Ukraine, an effort to apply international pressure on Russia to negotiate https://t.co/RXyOqo9fpN
SiriusXM revived Neil Young’s radio channel after Spotify refused to cut Joe Rogan’s lucrative podcast, and other streamers promoted the folk-rocker https://t.co/lcEwxTEBIc

A Sandro Botticelli portrait of Jesus Christ with bloodshot eyes and a halo of tiny, weeping angels sold for $45.4 million on Thursday in the latest sign of the art market’s resilience https://t.co/mrwylpK1ac
Three shots of vaccine cut the risk of death from Covid-19 by 95% in those age 50 and older during the Omicron surge in the U.K. https://t.co/nOow0XstQT
Virginia has set up an email hotline where parents can send complaints about what Gov. Glenn Youngkin has called “divisive teaching practices” such as critical race theory https://t.co/SkwhW7rCO9

Eight years after Russia seized Ukraine’s Crimean peninsula and fomented war in the country’s east, Kyiv’s once-feeble military is bigger and better armed. It is still far outgunned by Moscow. https://t.co/AJ0fpC9hSB
Europe is enlisting the U.S. to help secure more energy supplies in case a conflict in Ukraine interrupts the flow of natural gas from Russia https://t.co/Aga5EEe5jF

From @WSJopinion: Politicians and public-health officials owe an apology to Americans who lost their jobs on the false premises that only unvaccinated people could spread the virus and only vaccination could prevent its spread, writes @MartyMakary https://t.co/olwVpnZ981
China’s foreign minister warned Washington against doing anything to hype up the Ukraine-Russia crisis https://t.co/oF8iMedspM

Spotify took down Neil Young’s music after the folk-rock star asked that it be removed over what he said is fake information about Covid-19 vaccines being spread on the platform through Joe Rogan’s podcast #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/UD1xXj975x https://t.co/0enDtAIOFu
Twitter said it suspended an account that tried to spoil the results for online word game Wordle by tweeting what it said were future answers to players https://t.co/d1HLYNg5Ib
President Biden signed an executive order Wednesday making sexual harassment a crime under military law https://t.co/ih1uhJPwX9

A complaint from a prominent Indian opposition politician against Twitter about an alleged government effort to limit his ability to attract followers throws a fresh spotlight on how New Delhi polices U.S. social media companies https://t.co/bT8pbFieZt
Spotify has removed Neil Young’s music, the company confirmed Wednesday, as the folk-rock star isn’t wavering in his objections to Joe Rogan’s podcast https://t.co/elCm9j4u5E
The second-longest streak in “Jeopardy!” history ended Wednesday, as Amy Schneider lost after 40 consecutive wins https://t.co/CdbScMY12r

The city council of San Jose, Calif., has approved an ordinance requiring gun owners to insure their firearms and pay an annual fee, in what appears to be the first measure of its kind in the U.S. https://t.co/Qk94V3Nepb

Breaking: Neil Young’s music is being removed from Spotify, people familiar with the matter say. He requested it be taken down earlier this week over objections to what he said is vaccine misinformation being spread by podcaster Joe Rogan on the service. https://t.co/DxmmDlfls6
Scientists were able to regrow missing limbs in frogs through a cocktail of drugs, new research shows, in a notable advance for regenerative medicine https://t.co/dXTOGCVRxC
Justice Stephen Breyer will retire from the Supreme Court, Sen. Schumer said. President Biden has pledged to appoint a Black woman to fill the post. https://t.co/LiL2iv6FBs
Lourdes Maldonado, a well-known local television personality in Tijuana, became the second Mexican journalist in a week to be gunned down in the border city https://t.co/3HQ1eVoigt
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/s0E7kDE8EE
Neil Young says Spotify has a responsibility to mitigate the spread of misinformation on its platform https://t.co/CLTr6PgaoX
Lourdes Maldonado, a well-known local television personality in Tijuana, became the second Mexican journalist in a week to be gunned down in the border city https://t.co/2rqZ0Wiqrl

Elon Musk wants McDonald’s to start accepting dogecoin for payment. The Tesla CEO has repeatedly touted the cryptocurrency, saying his company would accept it for payment for some merchandise. https://t.co/Yi1LQAtR7l
Moms looking for virtual camaraderie can find kinder, gentler online communities in alternative apps and websites explains @juliejargon #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/iaZlXcf7b1 https://t.co/FRp3XwW3Fp
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/c8O1QDsvv3 https://t.co/MKPO7nB2Ku
Breaking: Covid-19 deaths in the U.S. reached the highest level since last February after Omicron, though milder for some, spread with record-breaking speed https://t.co/POFb7IbMkc
Breaking: David Ortiz was elected to baseball’s Hall of Fame. Barry Bonds and Roger Clemens, tied to the sport's steroid era, were denied entry. https://t.co/qNU5L1UPci
Meta said that its research team built a new artificial intelligence supercomputer that the Facebook parent company maintains will soon be the fastest in the world https://t.co/JPwHbAerwR

Elon Musk wants McDonald’s to start accepting dogecoin for payment. The Tesla CEO has repeatedly touted the cryptocurrency, saying his company would accept it for payment for some merchandise. https://t.co/dpqpTtPdMD
As Roger Federer fades and Novak Djokovic runs into travel hurdles, Rafael Nadal is one match away from the Australian Open final https://t.co/lz9Nj0eYiR
Neil Young says Spotify has a responsibility to mitigate the spread of misinformation on its platform https://t.co/Fax7aBR55x
Pfizer has begun testing a vaccine that targets the Omicron variant. Initial study results are expected in the first half of the year. https://t.co/Rm6ribIl75

Facebook says it’s helping millions of the world’s poorest people get online through programs that allow them free data. Many of these people end up being charged, collectively, an estimated millions of dollars a month. https://t.co/oKu9LdoRKK
Sony Music said it bought Bob Dylan’s entire catalog of recorded music, spanning the artist's six-decade career https://t.co/lRnqD767Zl
A stampede at a soccer stadium in Cameroon’s capital city killed at least six people and injured many more during an international tournament https://t.co/yMNGt0xr6G
Amy Schneider has won her 39th straight "Jeopardy!" game, the second-longest winning streak ever behind Ken Jennings https://t.co/glu5q6pHdA
President Biden called a Fox News reporter who asked him about the potential political consequences of inflation a “stupid son of a bitch” at a White House event Monday https://t.co/uehPFYLgFE

Seven Virginia school boards sued Republican Gov. Glenn Youngkin for making mask-wearing in schools optional, arguing that the executive order set to take effect Monday violates the commonwealth’s constitution https://t.co/kzYgQhRmF1
President Biden called a Fox News reporter who asked him about the potential political consequences of inflation a “stupid son of a bitch” at a White House event Monday https://t.co/4FZq3gRmGJ
Amy Schneider has won her 39th straight "Jeopardy!" game, the second-longest winning streak ever behind Ken Jennings https://t.co/CR5iKdsRFF

From @WSJopinion: Biden suggests that Germany is one of America’s most important allies, writes @TomRtweets. Given Berlin’s policies toward the nation’s two pre-eminent adversaries, it’s hard to see how Biden’s claim holds up. https://t.co/WVG4WjmLF3

Washington, D.C., and some states filed new lawsuits against Google, accusing it of deceiving consumers by recording their location even after users tried to turn off the company’s tracking https://t.co/BkvNrTKhNA

Russian President Vladimir Putin wants to move against Ukraine now because he sees it slipping away from his grasp, writes @GeraldFSeib. But the reasons he may think he’s free to act actually lie in three other countries. https://t.co/bF8yB8uTlO
The Pentagon placed hundreds of U.S. troops on standby for deployment to Eastern Europe, officials said, an escalation toward U.S. military involvement https://t.co/4rhFOMNSCK
